comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I'm afraid I won't be able to help with dating the shot as I was hitched by 1973 and Zero's Disco was not on my social calendar.  Just a few aspects to point out, all the cars are facing west as the north quays were one way in that direction at that time, that didn't change until after 1978.  The facility was now boarded or galvanised up as it had become a meeting place for (shock horror) gay men and a number of muggings had taken place there.  We're gone away from that abuse of gay people (I hope?)  In the distance you can see the green copper top to the tower in Guiness's and the chimney nearby which I think is gone now?  The Liffey doesn't look too bad but believe me it still stank and was not nearly as clean as it is today!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] That's terrible about the muggings! Did not know that. Do you know what that Guinness tower is called, or if there's a nickname for it - sure there must be? And thanks for spotting the cars/one way system. Complete opposite to now.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The caption on a photo on this link says it's called St Patricks Tower cobb.smugmug.com/Europe/Ireland/Guinness-Brewery-Dublin-8... And according to this link it was the "largest smock windmill" in Europe, it was actually used to power the making of Roes WHISKEY!!! and not Guiness at all, and that's a surprise to me!! www.classicwhiskey.com/history/georowhis.htm

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Thanks! Also finding it (now that you did most of the donkey work!) as St. Patrick's Mill...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 36844288@N00
comment._content: The urinal was one of the French style pissoirs imported prior to the 1932 Dublin Eucharistic Congress as part of a 'clean up Dublin' campaign.

comment.author: 26640250@N02
comment._content: The term pissoir is correct. I remember this well, my mother used to reluctantly let me look inside. I also remember the smell in there.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sebfotos] Do you remember any of the others around town? One was spotted in this photo...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 36844288@N00
comment._content: I think the last one I recall was at Fairview at the end of Malahide Road in c1980 - I'm sure there was a debate about its removal.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/36844288@N00] Excellent! Thanks a million, and your info is now up under the photo. Hopefully other people will be able to add more...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
